website_summaries.verdict: A little pricier per ounce than some others, but it begins working on fleas and ticks immediately.
pros: Safer to use around people and animals than some other carpet flea powders
Will give you up to 550-square-feet of coverage per bottle
May be used on upholstery and pet beds, as well as carpet
Begins killing fleas and ticks upon contact
Has a pleasing smell after application
cons: Dangerous to use around puppies or pregnant dogs

customer_reviews.title: Worked well.
customer_reviews.text: We have large dogs, and obviously with that and the warm climate in San Diego, brings fleas like no other. We had a flea infestation in the carpet, and put this powder down over night and *poof* there were no fleas on my dog. However, be mindful about how much powder you're laying down because the directions have you use a broom to kind of push the powder around the carpet. In doing so, it will raise a cloud of powder in your house, and the smell is super strong.
customer_reviews.author: Erwin G. Miguel

customer_reviews.title: PRODUCT WORKS - VERY MESSY TO USE
customer_reviews.text: This product does work as described. The smell is not unpleasant but is a little overwhelming so I opened the windows and doors to circulate air as I was applying it to my carpets, thats when the powder blew everywhere. The instructions say to sweep it around with a broom in order for it to penetrate into the carpets, not a good idea, it was all over everything! Had to wipe down every piece of furniture. Use the spray version instead, much easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: ELIZABETH BRADFORD

customer_reviews.title: Does Nothing
customer_reviews.text: Does absolutely nothing. Have even let it sit for days on the carpet (they suggest 24hrs). Have seen fleas walking on it. Also note “ This item isn't eligible for return” Also bought same brand spray. Same results. Very little affect at all so save your money. Buy raid it was the only thing thing worked. Tried over $100 of products, powders, floggers, sprays etc
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you need maintenance..I wouldn't use it to treat an infestation alone
customer_reviews.text: Living in South Florida, flea season is no joke. I treat both of my animals (dog and cat) with flea collars with 8 month protection , but still the flea come in on the dog's feet and then boom! Fleas in the house. I use this carpet powder once a week or once every two weeks, leave it on my bedroom carpet, the dogs bed, and my living room rug. I haven't had a problem since I started using this on a regular basis. This is also a way better price than in the pet stores! P.S. this also smells HEAVENLY!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but what a mess.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works pretty well, but what a mess! I'm still dusting powder off my furniture that floats up out of the carpet. I ended up having a professional spray for the fleas in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Robs

customer_reviews.title: Completely false advertising
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this. I put three containers of this powder in my basement over the last week. And hundreds of fleas jump on me constantly when I go downstairs they have not gone away they have not gotten better they are disgusting and powder does absolutely nothing. I had to buy a flea bomb and we will see how that goes. Even after doing my carpets and putting this on my dog they still went on. This is justCompletely false advertising
customer_reviews.author: Jody C.

customer_reviews.title: Great flea powder
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm. Easy to sprinkle around and clean up. Noticed no more flea bites directly after applying the powder.
customer_reviews.author: Sofi NW

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's a great product. It was very easy to use. The only words of advice I can give is, this is a very light powder. I forgot to turn off the ceiling fan when I applied it. It went all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Teague

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Smells good, just be ready to open windows and doors for good air flow cause it does puff up due to it's very powdery texture.
customer_reviews.author: Briana Richey

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Smells good but didn’t work. Use Pert Plus to wash your pets and as a carpet cleaner so you don’t spend a ton of money to get rid of a flea infestation due to products not working.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy A.

customer_reviews.title: Not shampoo.
customer_reviews.text: Got it and not what I ordered! I ordered the shampoo, twice got fleas after treatment cream. I want the treatment shampoo. Someone needs to learn to read their orders closer
customer_reviews.author: paris57

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This gets everywhere and it will ruin your vacumme with all the dust
customer_reviews.author: monica

customer_reviews.title: Works well, hard to clean up.
customer_reviews.text: The product seemed appealing since it’s safe to use around animals. It works for sure, but be prepared for a lot of cleanup. Even sweeping gently kicked up a whole lot of dust. For vacuuming, I recommend using a hose extension since the powder will cake up and clog your roller vacuum. We’re buying the spray version of this next time for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No way
customer_reviews.text: So stinky after application I had to wash everything. Smells ok in container but horrible later.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Flea powder
customer_reviews.text: Smells good but doesn’t kill or prevent fleas on my toy poodle. Switched back to drops and no more itching.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed so far
customer_reviews.text: I will update but so far 4 days haven't seen much in the way of it working.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory S.

customer_reviews.title: Good natural flea killer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great natural product to get rid of fleas. Does a good job for eggs and fleas.
customer_reviews.author: HS

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product and still had fleas in the carpet 3 weeks later. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Strassner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: For an all-natural tick repellent, it works well and smells pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: best
customer_reviews.text: Better than bombing your house. This killed them and smell was not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Stitzman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Never saw fleas on carpet, but used anyway to be safe
customer_reviews.author: NAME_Willie RadfordT_RETURNED

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to vacuum out of carpet. Clogged the vacuum and very strong smell.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Not what I thought it would be and didn't work and messed up my vacuum
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Roach

customer_reviews.title: Smoke and mirrors
customer_reviews.text: It looks like scarface sneezed in my apartment. Powder EVERYWHERE. I'm literally cleaning it off if the top on my refrigerator. It says to use a broom to spread it. Dont do it! It's a trap! I mean it works but the clean up is not worth it. Especially if you have allergies,kids, or even love your pets. If you hate your hate your family and LOVE to vacuum for 4 days straight then definitely use this.
customer_reviews.author: Ciara W.

customer_reviews.title: 3 of my cats have died
customer_reviews.text: Used on the carpet 2 weeks ago and now 3 of my cats are dead. Maybe it's just a coincidence, but I doubt it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: TropiClean Natural Flea & Tick Sprays & Powder for Dogs, Made in USA
product_meta.description: Style:Carpet Powder| Size:11 ozTropiClean Natural Flea & Tick Carpet Powder kills fleas and ticks on carpets and upholstery. It’s powerful natural ingredients continue to repel for up to 30 days. Our unique blend including sodium bicarbonate (baking soda) works at removing odors leaving a pleasant scent. TropiClean Carpet Powder can also be used on dogs and pet bedding.
feature_bullets: TropiClean Natural Flea & Tick Carpet Powder kills and repels fleas and ticks on carpets and upholstery.
Powerful natural ingredients continue to repel for up to 30 days.

Our Natural Flea and Tick Carpet Powder contains no pyrethrin or permethrin. With 5 EPA-approved natural essential oils - clove oil, lemongrass oil, cedarwood oil, cinnamon oil and sesame seed oil - for a pleasant citrus aroma.
Our unique combination of natural essential oils and baking soda helps to effectively repel fleas, ticks, larvae and eggs.

One 11 ounce TropiClean Flea & Tick Powder is enough to treat up to 5 rooms when used as directed. Apply 2 ounces per 100 square feet of surface area. For maximum efficacy, wait 24 hours before (lightly) vacuuming. Always read instructions before use.

Want even more fresh moments? Our natural pet products include dental care, itch relief, flea & tick solutions and an array of grooming products all designed to let your pet put their best paw forward. You make the moments, we make them fresh.
Safe around dogs and cats when used as directed.
For use around dogs and cats 16 weeks and older.
Contains one (1) 11oz bottle of TropiClean Flea and Tick Carpet Powder.
